      • createTable

        public java.lang.String createTable(com.viper.database.model.Database database,
                                    com.viper.database.model.Table table)
        Given the table bean, generate a sql string which will create a view as defined by the table bean.
        Parameters:
        database - the database definition
        table - the table definition
        Returns:
        the sql string for creating a table. The following is the mysql "create view" syntax: 
         CREATE
 [OR REPLACE]
 [ALGORITHM = {UNDEFINED | MERGE | TEMPTABLE}]
 [DEFINER = { user | CURRENT_USER }]
 [SQL SECURITY { DEFINER | INVOKER }]
 VIEW view_name [(column_list)]
 AS select_statement
 [WITH [CASCADED | LOCAL] CHECK OPTION]
 
 select_statement:
 [IGNORE | REPLACE] [AS] SELECT ... (Some legal select statement)

      • alterTable

        public java.lang.String alterTable(com.viper.database.model.Database database,
                                   com.viper.database.model.Table from,
                                   com.viper.database.model.Table to)
        Given the table bean, generate a sql string which will alter the table as defined by the table bean. The following is the mysql "alter table" syntax: 
         ALTER [IGNORE] TABLE tbl_name
 alter_specification [, alter_specification] ...
 
 alter_specification:
 ADD [COLUMN] column_definition [FIRST | AFTER col_name ]
 | ADD [COLUMN] (column_definition,...)
 | ADD INDEX [index_name] [index_type] (index_col_name,...)
 | ADD [CONSTRAINT [symbol]] PRIMARY KEY [index_type]
 (index_col_name,...)
 | ADD [CONSTRAINT [symbol]] UNIQUE [index_name] [index_type]
 (index_col_name,...)
 | ADD [FULLTEXT|SPATIAL] [index_name] (index_col_name,...)
 | ADD [CONSTRAINT [symbol]] FOREIGN KEY [index_name]
 (index_col_name,...) [reference_definition]
 | ALTER [COLUMN] col_name {SET DEFAULT literal | DROP DEFAULT}
 | CHANGE [COLUMN] old_col_name column_definition [FIRST|AFTER
 col_name]
 | MODIFY [COLUMN] column_definition [FIRST | AFTER col_name]
 | DROP [COLUMN] col_name
 | DROP PRIMARY KEY
 | DROP INDEX index_name
 | DROP FOREIGN KEY fk_symbol
 | DISABLE KEYS
 | ENABLE KEYS
 | RENAME [TO] new_tbl_name
 | ORDER BY col_name
 | CONVERT TO CHARACTER SET charset_name [COLLATE collation_name]
 | [DEFAULT] CHARACTER SET charset_name [COLLATE collation_name]
 | DISCARD TABLESPACE
 | IMPORT TABLESPACE
 | table_options
 | ADD [CONSTRAINT [symbol]] UNIQUE [index_name] [index_type]
 (index_col_name,...)

        public java.lang.String renameTable(com.viper.database.model.Database database,
                                    com.viper.database.model.Table table,
                                    java.lang.String newTablename)
        Given the table bean, generate a sql string which will rename the table as defined by the table bean. The following is the mysql "rename table" syntax:
        remove the old name from table bean and make old name a calling argument.

      • createIndex

        public java.lang.String createIndex(com.viper.database.model.Database database,
                                    com.viper.database.model.Table table,
                                    com.viper.database.model.Index index)
        Given the database bean, generate a sql string which will create the index as defined by the database bean. The following is the mysql "create index" syntax:
        Parameters:
        database -
        table -
        index - 
         CREATE [UNIQUE|FULLTEXT|SPATIAL] INDEX index_name
 [index_type]
    ON tbl_name (index_col_name,...)
    [index_type]
 
 index_col_name:
    col_name [(length)] [ASC | DESC]
 
 index_type:
    USING {BTREE | HASH | RTREE}

      • renameIndex

        public java.lang.String renameIndex(com.viper.database.model.Database database,
                                    com.viper.database.model.Table table,
                                    com.viper.database.model.Index index,
                                    java.lang.String name)
        Given the database bean, generate a SQL string which will rename the index as defined by the database bean. The following is the MySql "rename index" syntax:
        Parameters:
        database -
        table -
        index -
        name -
        Returns:
        the SQL string for dropping the specific index. 
         RENAME INDEX <old_index_name> [ON <table_name>] TO <new_index_name>

      • createForeignKey

        public java.lang.String createForeignKey(com.viper.database.model.Database database,
                                         com.viper.database.model.Table table,
                                         com.viper.database.model.ForeignKey foreignKey)
        Given the table bean, generate a sql string which will alter the table as defined by the table bean. The following is the mysql "alter table" syntax:
        Parameters:
        database -
        table -
        foreignKey - 
         ALTER [IGNORE] TABLE tbl_name
 alter_specification [, alter_specification] ...
 
 alter_specification:
 | ADD [CONSTRAINT [symbol]] FOREIGN KEY [index_name]
 (index_col_name,...) [reference_definition]
 | DROP FOREIGN KEY fk_symbol
        ALTER TABLE table_name ADD CONSTRAINT constraint_name FOREIGN KEY (col1, col2) REFERENCES table_2 (cola,colb);
